Proverbs__08.1: Doth not wisdom cry aloud, and prudence put forth her voice?
Proverbs__08.2: Standing in the top of the highest places by the way, in the midst of the paths.
Proverbs__08.3: Beside the gates of the city, in the very doors she speaketh, saying:
Proverbs__08.4: O ye men, to you I call, and my voice is to the sons of men.
Proverbs__08.5: O little ones, understand subtilty, and ye unwise, take notice.
Proverbs__08.6: Hear, for I will speak of great things: and my lips shall be opened to preach right things.
Proverbs__08.7: My mouth shall meditate truth, and my lips shall hate wickedness.
Proverbs__08.8: All my words are just, there is nothing wicked nor perverse in them.
Proverbs__08.9: They are right to them that understand, and just to them that find knowledge.
Proverbs__08.10: Receive my instruction, and not money: choose knowledge rather than gold.
Proverbs__08.11: For wisdom is better than all the most precious things: and whatsoever may be desired cannot be compared to it.
Proverbs__08.12: I wisdom dwell in counsel, and am present in learned thoughts.
Proverbs__08.13: The fear of the Lord hateth evil: I hate arrogance, and pride, and every wicked way, and a mouth with a double tongue.
Proverbs__08.14: Counsel and equity is mine, prudence is mine, strength is mine.
Proverbs__08.15: By me kings reign, and lawgivers decree just things,
Proverbs__08.16: By me princes rule, and the mighty decree justice.
Proverbs__08.17: I love them that love me: and they that in the morning early watch for me, shall find me.
Proverbs__08.18: With me are riches and glory, glorious riches and justice.
Proverbs__08.19: For my fruit is better than gold and the precious stone, and my blossoms than choice silver.
Proverbs__08.20: I walk in the way of justice, in the midst of the paths of judgment,
Proverbs__08.21: That I may enrich them that love me, and may fill their treasures.
Proverbs__08.22: The Lord possessed me in the beginning of his ways, before he made any thing from the beginning.
Proverbs__08.23: I was set up from eternity, and of old before the earth was made.
Proverbs__08.24: The depths were not as yet, and I was already conceived. neither had the fountains of waters as yet sprung out:
Proverbs__08.25: The mountains with their huge bulk had not as yet been established: before the hills I was brought forth:
Proverbs__08.26: He had not yet made the earth, nor the rivers, nor the poles of the world.
Proverbs__08.27: When he prepared the heavens, I was present: when with a certain law and compass he enclosed the depths:
Proverbs__08.28: When he established the sky above, and poised the fountains of waters:
Proverbs__08.29: When he compassed the sea with its bounds, and set a law to the waters that they should not pass their limits: when be balanced the foundations of the earth;
Proverbs__08.30: I was with him forming all things: and was delighted every day, playing before him at all times;
Proverbs__08.31: Playing in the world: and my delights were to be with the children of men.
Proverbs__08.32: Now therefore, ye children, hear me: Blessed are they that keep my ways.
Proverbs__08.33: Hear instruction and be wise, and refuse it not.
Proverbs__08.34: Blessed is the man that heareth me, and that watcheth daily at my gates, and waiteth at the posts of my doors.
Proverbs__08.35: He that shall find me, shall find life, and shall have salvation from the Lord:
Proverbs__08.36: But he that shall sin against me, shall hurt his own soul. All that hate me love death.
